reviews.title: Great rooftop breakfast
reviews.text: This hotel is about 8 blocks from train station and about a mile and a quarter from the Spanish steps. It is easily walkable from train station (15 minutes). Nice thing about location is that you are in a quieter neighborhood and it is away from the crowds. Location is in a commercial area with businesses and office buildings and the like. Felt very safe in neighborhood. Reception referred us to 2 neighborhood italian restaurants within 3 blocks, and both were casual with nice atmosphere. Food was good and house wines were great and reasonably priced.

reviews.title: Highly Recommended, Lovely & Quiet, Sharp Staff And Comfortable
reviews.text: Best thing about hotel was rooftop restaurant (6th floor?). Breakfast was included in the hotel price and was best breakfast we had in 2 weeks of being in Europe. Try the orange juice. Great. Coffee. Great. Rest of breafkfast-great. Great variety.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was friendly. Wireless Internet available. Small reception area, but comfortable. 2 grocery/deli stores within 2 blocks. No shopping in area. A bit away from tourist areas, although we made the walk once or twice a day. A couple miles from the heart of Rome (Pantheon, Trevi, Piaza Venezia). A little farther to Coliseum, but Rome is very walkable.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — The decor in the rooms - but this was such a minor point.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would probably stay closer to heart of Rome next visit, but this was not bad. Rooms small as is typical in Rome. It is a neighborhood hotel, and a bit old but with character. There are a lot of hotels in this area, and all seem to be nice. A/C did not work well, so we opened window to street. Kind of loud, as there is a late night gelato store right in front of hotel. Awesome gelato-you can see them make it through a big picture window.
reviews.title: Great Place to Get About in Rome

likes.liked: — The Piano Bar on the seventh floor
likes.disliked: — no tea and coffee making facilities in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location on a quiet street within walking distance of most of the sights. 10 to 15 mins from Trevi Fountain which is located amongst lots of shops, Cafes and Restruants etc....
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel and Staff

likes.disliked: — No coffee making facilities in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are VERY small, “complimentary" WiFi is 6 euro to connect to, the rooftop terrace is terribly overpriced (8 euro for a draft beer! - any store about a half a block away beer is .90 euro) and the waiter was beyond rude. The location is a bit out of the way for most popular spots -- try staying closer to central Rome to stay within walking distance of most sights.
reviews.title: Beware.

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for single business travelers, defiantly NOT a family or couple looking for a romantic stay in Rome!!!
reviews.title: Staff are wonderful - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Keep in mind 4 star hotels in Europe are close to American 3 stars, try to fork up more dough for a 5 star if you can, it will make your visit to Rome much more memorable
reviews.title: Excellent friendly hotel

reviews.text: Our party of 6 (grandparents, parents and kids) stayed at the Marcella Royal for 2 nights in May 2008, and really liked the place. The staff were very friendly and gave us excellent recommendations on restaurants. The rooms were very spacious in comparison with other hotels in Rome. Make sure to have a late night drink on the roof garden! Its very pleasant.
reviews.title: Friendly and helpful staff

reviews.text: It was my husband's 60th birthday and retirement celebration at the end of May 2008 and we booked the Marcella Royal on the basis of other people's reviews. We can only repeat the previous comments about the excellent, helpful staff behind reception who were always welcoming and friendly. We had some very good recommendations for restaurants - La Pentolaccia was a particular favourite. When we arrived at the hotel there was some confusion about whether the air conditioning was working in the room allocated to us and we were moved to another room. This was very small and next morning we asked for a change of room. This was dealt with very easily and we went back to the original room where it transpired that the air con was working fine. In the confusion of moving rooms back I managed to leave my husband's birthday gift at the back of one of the drawers of the small room. Luckily for me, when we arrived back at reception after a day out the receptionist handed me the wrapped gift to say that it had been found in the room. So, there is no doubt that the staff are honest (it was a rather expensive watch) and what could have been a disaster was just an embarrassment (for me). We agree that the only improvement would be prepared fresh fruit with breakfast instead of the tinned stuff, but that is a small criticism. We enjoyed the Piano Bar in the evening for a drink after dinner and we would definitely stay at this hotel if we return to Rome (to finish the sightseeing that we didn't manage to fit in during our 5 night visit).
reviews.title: Lovely staff, small clean rooms, residential neighborhood

likes.disliked: — no iron available in room; some rooms quite small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just spent 3 days at this lovely hotel very clean ,and fresh sheets and towels everyday.Lovely comfortable room. Roof top restaurant brilliant wonderful views over rome great breakfast choice. Would stay here again was just perfect.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read many reviews we decided to book the Marcella and i have to say that i am pleased we did. Much has been said about the beautiful rooftop gardens in previous posts but having sampled the goods myself i can only endorse the good comments. Believe me you will do a lot of walking in Rome! So the chance to relax with a night cap with views above the city and pleasant piano music playing in the back ground is well worth the wait. Indeed what better way to start a day than to have a nice breakfast with the same views.
reviews.title: Loved the Rooftop!

reviews.text: OK, the nitty gritty. You will need walking shoes although don't be afraid to use the metro/buses and taxis. The hotel bar is not cheap so expect to pay more euros for a beer than in many local restuarants (approx 8). A bottle of wine is better value!
reviews.title: Price value ration is there!

likes.liked: — The value for our budget constraints.
likes.disliked: — Location and the adjoining room situation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are fine if a little small and we were on the sixth floor but were not disturbed by the noise from the restuarant above.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - a bit far out though

reviews.text: There is no iron so bring your own. The staff are curteous and helpful. It is a boutique hotel not a major chain so don't expect it to behave that way.
reviews.title: We loved the Marcella Royal

likes.liked: — Rooms attractive baths well supplied and large

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in town for a friends wedding, I found the location great but it was a little ways from the "tourist" attractions. The rooms were a bit small, but most Hotels in Europe are. I had breakfast in their rooftoop garden restaurant, great views of the city!
reviews.title: Good Hotel.

reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for a week in June on a combined conference/holiday trip.
reviews.title: Good hotel - no major complaints

likes.liked: — This is a hotel that has everything you need, nice and problemfree stay
likes.disliked: — No major complaints - minor issuses: a bit far from the major tourist places, dirty carpet in the room, expensive and unreliable internet connection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a little late with the booking (approx two months prior to our trip), so the choice in good hotels were limited. Chose this one after reading so many great rewievs here at tripadvisor. At the time we booked, there were only one room avaliable for our entire stay. This was a superior room, which the hotel charges €350 per night for. We booked through expedia.com and paid far less:-)
reviews.title: Charming boutique hotel in Rome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we checked in and were taken to our room. We got room 618, which was the third largest room in the hotel. It had a bathroom with shower/bathtub, a small hallway with lots of warderobe space, a fairly large "main" area with a big bed (which was quite comfortable), and a small narrow space by the window with a desk and minibar/fridge. And a great view of the Roman rooftops!
reviews.title: fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the room was clean and nice. However, I would like to point out that the wall-to-wall carpet was extremely dirty... Other than that - no complaints. The room was cleaned once a day, clean towels were provided each day, they changed the sheets several times during our stay, and they checked the room in the afternoon as well (made up the bed if needed etc).
reviews.title: A Great Find
